page.title: 17GUIDE DOGS FOR THE BLIND
page.content: The lifeblood of Horwich in the past has been its strong community life.The group who carried out this survey have concentrated on finding out about voluntary and council old folks' homes and pre-school childrens' playgroups. We have moulded plasticine at Hilton Avenue Mums' and Toddlers' Group,read stories in St.Catherine's Church Hall,performed plays at Flockton Court and made many friends at Old Hall Crescent and the Manse Private Rest Home. Eventually this interest in the community has led us into charity work.One of the most active in the area is Guide Dogs For the Blind, locally organised by the redoubtable Mrs.Wooff who is blind herself but inspires many to raise Â£1000 necessary to train each dog.
